definition: word/statement/speech/lyrics/CL:組|组[zu3],個|个[ge4]/a form of lyric poetry, flourishing in the Song dynasty 宋朝|宋朝[Song4 chao2]/CL:首[shou3]
to juggle with words (dishonestly)/to be a hypocrite and hide behind florid rhetoric

sentences.english: He likes to use an ornate style when writing.
sentences.chinese: 他写文章时喜欢雕砌词藻。

sentences.english: It is propagandistic and manipulates the reader with purple prose.
sentences.chinese: 它用华丽的词藻堆砌起来的散文劝诱和操纵读者。

sentences.english: To load one's writing with ornate and fancy phrases.
sentences.chinese: 他写文章时喜欢雕砌词藻。

sentences.english: Don't conceal the poverty of thought by the eccentric diction.
sentences.chinese: 不要用这些怪僻的词藻来掩饰思想的贫乏。

sentences.english: They are terser, more to the point and less euphuistic.
sentences.chinese: 它们更为简洁，更加切中要点，而更少止于华丽词藻。

sentences.english: He used to use a lot of flowers of speech in his writing.
sentences.chinese: 过去他在写作中爱用华丽的词藻。

sentences.english: It gave them words to attatch to their feelings.
sentences.chinese: 诗歌提供了词藻来抒写他们的感情。

sentences.english: The chapter is mostly wordy rhetoric.
sentences.chinese: 这一章多为冗长的华丽词藻。

sentences.english: So, there's this kind of very flowery, at time symbolic, kind of account.
sentences.chinese: 所以，有这些词藻华丽，但同时也具象征意义的故事。

definition: literary talent/literary grace/rich and bright colors
(of a writing etc) to have no substance (idiom)/to carry no weight
empty cave, nothing there (idiom); devoid of substance/nothing new to show
variant of 言辭|言辞[yan2 ci2]
